firstSessionFailures: High rate of student churn (24%) linked to poor first session experiences.
All tutors have a first session success rate of less than 50%, indicating systemic issues in session quality.
At-risk tutors show no improvement in first session success despite having a significant majority (91%).
commonRiskFactors: High percentage of at-risk tutors (91%) suggests widespread issues with tutor preparedness or engagement.
Lack of profile completion (<70%) in 27% of tutors may correlate with poor session quality and reliability.
Tutor unreliability is evident with 98.2% of reschedules being tutor-initiated, impacting student trust and retention.

systemRecommendations: Implement a rigorous onboarding and training program to improve tutor readiness and first session success rates.
Enforce a minimum profile completion threshold before tutors can begin sessions to ensure professionalism and preparedness.
Develop a monitoring system for tutor reliability, focusing on reducing reschedules and increasing accountability for no-shows.
